software engineer for more than 70 years cerulean has been synonymous with the supply of precision test and measurement equipment solutions for the tobacco industry. with continued release of new devices cerulean is committed to delivering the solutions that our customers require investing a significant proportion of its revenue on in house research and product development. this commitment demonstrates the cerulean philosophy of innovation and continuous improvement.reporting to the software manager the successful candidate will be a key member of the software development team responsible for developing software using various technologies of the microsoft stack. the software developer would be responsible for writing code to cerulean standards that is used in a varied key products of the company. coordinating with the hardware engineers to ensure the software produces the desired results. working in various projects involving various technologies with opportunity to improve and learn.key responsibilities· solid understanding of the development lifecycle focusing on the microsoft stack.· create code that meets design specifications follows standards and is easy to maintain. when required make suggestions for new designs.· work with various teams in the organization and deal directly with design engineers to ensure appropriate project requirements are met.· good interpersonal and organizational skills.· ability to work in a cooperative team environment.· great team participation skills.required skills· bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field· 5+ years hands on development experience using the latest microsoft technologies· solid understanding of .net framework· expertise in c# .net wpf mvvm· strong understanding of design patterns and solid principles· sql server data storage and retrieval including writing complex queries · source control svn or git · experience with prism would be an advantage· experience of linux and c/c++ embedded systems would be an advantage· experience of ms visual basic would be an advantagepersonal attributes· ability to work in a team· should be able to confidently contribute in technical discussions· willingness to learn and improvedesirable· prior experience developing in an n tiered environment· understanding of scrum and agile.· understanding of plc programmingjoin the team!interested? we look forward to receiving your application.external agencies are kindly requested not to contact the company regarding this post

software engineer bbc news offers a wide range of stretching creative and impactful careers for talented people. we are the team that’s building the future of the bbc whilst delivering tv radio and online services to millions of people worldwide every day. in the elections team we are focused on giving the public clear information about the democratic process. we’re a full stack team focused on getting accurate information about elections results to our audience quickly at scale and most importantly clearly. often our audiences either don’t understand the electoral process the terminology used or struggle with numbers and it’s part of the bbc’s remit to help make this clear. we offer challenging work but with the time to think and do things right. we value diversity & inclusion everywhere at the bbc and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply for the role. if you are interested to know more about us please explore the following links: blogs: https://medium.com/bbc design engineering opensource: https://www.bbc.co.uk/opensource/ github: https://github.com/bbc general d+e info: https://www.bbc.com/backstage/design engineering technical: our stack is built from engineering excellence and continuous improvement. mentoring and training new team members. contributes to creating safe and inclusive working environments. we’re keen to speak with people who have experience designing developing and supporting large complex systems at scale with one or more modern programming languages and/or frameworks. this is a great opportunity to learn new skills and languages. we’d also be keen to see experience of cloud infrastructure and automated testing techniques. experience of project working and professional software development processes including agile behaviour driven development and test driven development would be preferable as well as supporting software in a production environment. finally we value experience communicating effectively with both technical and non technical colleagues at all levels in an organisation. we create and support reliable and scalable cloud based systems on amazon web services use git and github for version control continuous integration and continuous deployment. proud member of the disability confident employer scheme about disability confident a disability confident employer will generally offer an interview software engineer for more than 70 years cerulean has been synonymous with the supply of precision test and measurement equipment solutions for the tobacco industry. with continued release of new devices cerulean is committed to delivering the solutions that our customers require investing a significant proportion of its revenue on in house research and product development. this commitment demonstrates the cerulean philosophy of innovation and continuous improvement.reporting to the software manager the successful candidate will be a key member of the software development team responsible for developing software using various technologies of the microsoft stack. the software developer would be responsible for writing code to cerulean standards that is used in a varied key products of the company. coordinating with the hardware engineers to ensure the software produces the desired results. working in various projects involving various technologies with opportunity to improve and learn.key responsibilities· solid understanding of the development lifecycle focusing on the microsoft stack.· create code that meets design specifications follows standards and is easy to maintain. when required make suggestions for new designs.· work with various teams in the organization and deal directly with design engineers to ensure appropriate project requirements are met.· good interpersonal and organizational skills.· ability to work in a cooperative team environment.· great team participation skills.required skills· bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field· 5+ years hands on development experience using the latest microsoft technologies· solid understanding of .net framework· expertise in c# .net wpf mvvm· strong understanding of design patterns and solid principles· sql server data storage and retrieval including writing complex queries · source control svn or git · experience with prism would be an advantage· experience of linux and c/c++ embedded systems would be an advantage· experience of ms visual basic would be an advantagepersonal attributes· ability to work in a team· should be able to confidently contribute in technical discussions· willingness to learn and improvedesirable· prior experience developing in an n tiered environment· understanding of scrum and agile.· understanding of plc programmingjoin the team!interested? we look forward to receiving your application.external agencies are kindly requested not to contact the company regarding this post

software engineer bbc news offers a wide range of stretching creative and impactful careers for talented people. we are the team that’s building the future of the bbc whilst delivering tv radio and online services to millions of people worldwide every day. in the elections team we are focused on giving the public clear information about the democratic process. we’re a full stack team focused on getting accurate information about elections results to our audience quickly at scale and most importantly clearly. often our audiences either don’t understand the electoral process the terminology used or struggle with numbers and it’s part of the bbc’s remit to help make this clear. we offer challenging work but with the time to think and do things right. we value diversity & inclusion everywhere at the bbc and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply for the role. if you are interested to know more about us please explore the following links: blogs: https://medium.com/bbc design engineering opensource: https://www.bbc.co.uk/opensource/ github: https://github.com/bbc general d+e info: https://www.bbc.com/backstage/design engineering technical: our stack is built from javascript and golang. if you don’t know them we can train you so demonstrable skill in: javascript typescript python java golang are all acceptable if you’re willing to learn. we operate as a devops team and own our own infrastructure on aws; experience of working in this way is a plus. knowledge of sql databases or any other databases a plus. championing new technologies and approaches to ensure our products remain world class. collaborating effectively to deliver the best value audience experience. ensuring your code meets high quality standards through testing and peer reviews. people: working with others to get things done in a proactive and positive way. working with journalists and designers on new application concepts and building prototypes. contributing to an environment of engineering excellence and continuous improvement. mentoring and training new team members. contributes to creating safe and inclusive working environments. we’re keen to speak with people who have experience designing developing and supporting large complex systems at scale with one or more modern programming languages and/or frameworks. this is a great opportunity to learn new skills and languages. we’d also be keen to see experience of cloud infrastructure and automated testing techniques. experience of project working and professional software development processes including agile behaviour driven development and test driven development would be preferable as well as supporting software in a production environment. finally we value experience communicating effectively with both technical and non technical colleagues at all levels in an organisation. we create and support reliable and scalable cloud based systems on amazon web services use git and github for version control continuous integration and continuous deployment. proud member of the disability confident employer scheme about disability confident a disability confident employer will generally offer an interview to any applicant that declares they have a disability and meets the minimum criteria for the job as defined by the employer. it is important to note that in certain recruitment situations such as high volume seasonal and high peak times the employer may wish to limit the overall numbers of interviews offered to both disabled people and non disabled people. for more details please go to disability confident.

software engineer location: hybrid 40% onsite leeds blackpool or manchester essential:java javascript node.js sql postgressql mysql mongodb cassandra sql tuning kernel tuning explain plans patching and upgrade meet recovery point objectives meet recovery time objectives l2/l3 database build partitions git.deliver software products which make up services for our citizens to consumetransform business requirements into production ready codeintelligent resource is committed to barrier free and inclusive recruitment. we are a disability confident recruiter and a ridi 100 and business disability forum partner organisation.should you choose to contact intelligent resource regarding this role or apply for it all personal data you submit to us will be processed in accordance with our privacy notice which you can find on our website. proud member of the disability confident employer scheme about disability confident a disability confident employer will generally offer an interview to any applicant that declares they have a disability and meets the minimum criteria for the job as defined by the employer. it is important to note that in certain recruitment situations such as high volume seasonal and high peak times the employer may wish to limit the overall numbers of interviews offered to both disabled people and non disabled people. for more details please go to disability confident.

junior software engineer junior software engineersalary: £30k £36k depending on experience + excellent benefitslocation: bury manchesterfull time/permanentremarkable jobs are delighted to be working with a global client who is a market leader within their industry and assist them with the recruitment of a 'junior software engineer' to join their existing development team.this 'junior software developer' role will join an existing small team of developers and will be involved heavily with the design and delivery of software platforms primarily focussing on web development for web applications. key technologies that are used by the current ream include git java spring mysql angular java react and more.this 'junior software engineer' would be ideal for a candidate with a small amount of experience with full stack development or who is keen to develop their full stack knowledge. 'software engineer' main responsibilities:• build software components and modules following agreed patterns methodologies and designs.• investigate issues with deployed software and then create bug fixes.• understand the impact of different design options and manage risks.• participate code reviews on your own work and improve on software based on feedback.• contribute to wider technical discussions within the wider team. qualifications key skills and experience required for this 'software engineer' role:• degree educated or equivalent in a software engineering subject.• experienced with delivering software solutions.• possess knowledge of java spring and java script html css mysql or angular.• an understanding of software development techniques and deployment.• be keen to learn new systems and be a quick learner.• have excellent communication skills both written and verbal.• a strong team player with excellent organisational skills. for immediate consideration please apply today! interviews for this role will be conducted remotely.

senior software engineer senior software engineersalary: £70k £80klocation: remote based with occasional office visits to manchesterfull time/permanentremarkable jobs are delights to be working with a global software company who are quickly becoming a market leader within their industry. we are assisting our client with the recruitment of a 'senior software engineer' to join their existing development team.this 'senior software engineer' role will be joining a team that is responsible for building saas software for global customers. this role will be heavily involved with a long term project to enhance iterate and modernise a software platform.to be successful in this position you will need to be a self starter with advanced knowledge of technology platforms such as .net sql server and modern javascript development. 'senior software engineer' main responsibilities:• design and implement new software to meet specific requirements.• write well designed testable and secure code.• produce specification and determine operational feasibility.• develop the software verification process and quality assurance procedures.• integrate software components into a functioning software system.• provide feedback and suggest improvements to existing software and all aspects of the software development life cycle.• troubleshoot debug and apply upgrades to existing software to maintain performance and quality.• mentor junior team members on development best practises. experience skills and qualifications for this 'senior software engineer' role:• 4+ years of experience as a full stack javascript and .net developer.• highly proficient in javascript and enterprise web development.• excellent experience with .net core c# asp.net mvc and azure functions.• strong experience with git and microservices.• experienced with designing web apis on a large scale.• possess strong ms sql skills and experience with t sql.• knowledge of microsoft azure or aws.• the ability to work in a fast paced environment. for immediate consideration please apply today! interviews for this position will be conducted remotely.

junior or graduate software engineer graduate or junior software engineerestablished in 1985 crowder consulting consists of a growing team of over 120 consulting engineers software developers and data analysts. as an sme we are able to offer our leading water network management system netbase to water operators in the uk and internationally. our flagship netbase system is a data rich hub that acts as a digital twin of our client water operators’ networks with a suite of best practice applications providing source to tap insights for network monitoring operation optimisation management and regulatory reporting. our netbase digital services platform extends the value and insights of the netbase data hub providing advanced web based technologies and solutions supporting innovative analytics operational field services and leakage activities. our people are at the heart of what we do and we’re proud to say we’ve been investors in people accredited since 2004 testament to our dedication to support all colleagues with their career development. we are looking for junior software engineers or computer science graduates to join our development team and help drive the ambitious roadmap for our cloud based solutions and services. the role – graduate or junior software engineeras a software engineer you’ll work with some of the latest technologies and be involved in the end to end software development life cycle. you’ll carry out requirements analysis working closely with our in house domain experts; designing developing and testing components apis and applications; monitoring and supporting operational systems and implementing dev ops best practice and researching new technologies prototyping and bringing innovation to our solutions.the packageas a junior or graduate software engineer you’ll benefit from:• a starting salary of £25 000 or higher dependent upon your experience skills and qualifications • permanent contract working 37.5 hours per week monday to friday with flexible start times between 8am and 10am and finish times between 4:30pm and 6:30pm • employer contributory pension scheme• annual leave entitlement that increases with length of servicewe’re based in birkenhead although there may be a requirement for you to work from home initially due to the covid 19 government restrictions. we’re reviewing a hybrid approach to working post covid as suited to business requirements. our requirements – graduate or junior software engineeryou should be enthusiastic about the latest software trends and technologies and have a willingness to learn progress and grow within the team. you’ll also have: • degree level education in computer science or relevant subject and / or a foundation of experience within a similar software engineering role• experience of a high level programming language java python nodejs typescript c# • appreciation of software development practices and design ooad ddd tdd patterns although not essential exposure to any of the following would be advantageous:• developing desktop web or mobile applications• cloud technologies aws azure gcp serverless containers • web technologies rest api html5 javascript angular react • database technologies oracle mysql mongo dynamodb etc • devops practices and tools configuration as code ci/cd docker • experience of working in an agile environmentall applications for this junior or graduate software engineer vacancy are to be submitted online and strictly no agency calls or agency cv submissions.

associate software engineer are you starting your career as a software engineer?are you looking for an engaging environment with the opportunity to deliver innovative technology?we’re looking for outstanding software engineers who want to contribute to demanding and exciting digital services for the uk government. be part of changing the face of public services with the potential to dramatically transform the future of millions of people. our engineers build and run applications as part of a multi functional agile delivery teams. what really excites the successful candidate is delivery or continuation of software engineering activities.

software engineer what the job is about:new customer projects and a changing architecture landscape result in a bigger workload in which you can help us out by joining our software engineering team.as a java software engineer you’ll work on our core product ‘miles’ an erp software package covering all business aspects of a modern leasing company automotive finance or mobility provider.you’ll either work on improving the current application developing new modules or sometimes implement a customization project for one of the customers.'miles’ is built in java java 8 11 / quarkus / smart gwt . the database technologies that are currently used are oracle sql server and expanding to postgresql.innovation is important that’s why we’re making the shift to a next generation microservices architecture with a fully integrated ci/cd pipeline using technologies such as docker kubernetes and kafka.you will work in an international organization but one that has an informal atmosphere. it’s an environment in which you can take responsibility and initiative share your ideas and take part in the discussion.your interests and skills:you have a bachelor's or master's degree in computer science informatics or an equivalent degree.you are passionate about building state of the art solutions in java enterprise and you have some experience or interest in other current technologies.you love solving problems in a creative manner together with your team. you do this in a methodical way and continuously strive for results and quality.since sofico is an international company being fluent in english is important. you might be interested in our extended technology stack: java jee 8 11 java eclipse microprofile quarkus junit sql oracle ms sql server postgresql bamboo jenkins docker kubernetes kafka helm charts git ...we are looking for junior medior as well as senior profiles.what we offer:the opportunity to be part of a company that has been in business for over 30 years and is doubling in size every 5 years.an extensive onboarding program for you to become familiar with the product and the organization.a community driven organization supporting you in all aspects of your daily job heavily focusing on knowledge sharing best practices and training.the possibility to keep learning acquire the desired skills and be the driver of your own career.of course an attractive salary package based on your knowledge and experience with a company car.and in a normal situation coffee tea water are available at the office occasional after works drinks a bbq in the summer and lots of other fun team events.

software engineer software engineer | cheshire | 37.5 hours per week| £35 000 £42 000guardian controls is an electronics company specialising in the design and manufacture of energy efficient controls and monitoring to the refrigeration industry in the uk europe and internationally.we are growing and ambitious in our plans for the future and are looking to recruit a software engineer who will focus on embedded industrial software with control systems encompassing analogue io digital io vsds sensors and actuators. the right candidate will have 4 5 years commercial experience and be keen to evolve and apply their skills further.you will work monday to friday 9:00am to 5:00pm. there will be some flexibility in the number of hours worked and working days for the right candidate. the probationary serial protocols such as modbus desired• serial device interfaces such as i2c and spi desirable.• understanding of tcp/ip protocol stack desired tcp/ip dhcp etc. • understanding of socket based communications tcp / udp and higher layers: ftp http.• knowledge of lower layers of tcp ip stack is desirable but not essential.• understanding of cloud based services and communications.• understanding of wifi communications• experience with small footprint embedded systems development• understanding of control systems theory with appreciation for industrial environment.• understanding of svn and git source control systemsrole responsibilitiestaking direction from our head of engineering you will be responsible for the development of architecture design implementation test and roll out of software for control systems in the refrigeration industry both uk and internationally. working on a range of existing and new products in varying hardware platforms to implement new control systems or modify and release improved features for existing products. you will work on small footprint embedded micro controllers with our in house designed hardware with software interfacing to the hardware reading sensors and controlling actuators. our products are becoming more internet connected an understanding of tcp ip would be desirable.why you should apply• a company pension scheme is available 3 x salary life assurance and bonus subject to profitability.• holiday allowance 25 days per year plus public holidays.• the chance to join a fantastic growing company.• to become part of a hardworking dedicated team.• to showcase your current knowledge and skill set in the field.• to be a proactive member of the company.if you’re the ideal candidate our client is looking for please send your cv by clicking the apply button

responding to its needs for stability and availability and by being consistent with agreed platform principles. work to continuously improve the platform through removal of technical debt and championing of new technologies. provide technical analysis of user requirements to facilitate accurate story estimation. work closely with colleagues to share knowledge and ensure the continuous growth of our community oriented environment. ensure solutions have test coverage with a shift left mindset. evaluate the potential for automation to remove manual effort and increase efficiency.

software engineer want to do the best work of your life? with 24 million customers in 6 countries make your mark at europe's leading media and entertainment brand. a workplace where you can proudly be yourself; our people make sky a truly exciting and inclusive place to work. sky advertising technology provides innovative solutions to sky's advertising opportunities including the industry leading adsmart that allows our clients to precisely target their adverts to relevant households. as a software engineer you'll be helping to create those systems and be part of the migration of adtech systems into the cloud. what you'll do:* help to build applications that are core to sky's market leading adsmart platform * champion the departments adoption of cloud technologies * work with the automation tester to ensure we deliver well tested applications with a robust ci/cd pipeline. * engage with the wider adtech and sky developer communities. what you'll bring:* solid experience of delivering secure performant applications in a variety of languages java go c# python javascript/typescript and sql in a cloud based environment gcp/aws * good experience of infrastructure as code terraform kubernetes clusters and cloud native tools like big query cloud composer cloud build or their aws equivalents . * complete commitment to excellent software engineering standards. * an appetite to expand your horizons to look at new technology and assess how best to leverage it. department overview: we're the product hub. we're the team behind your favourite sky products and the platforms that power them. we make every moment magical everywhere. our team is made up of self motivated big thinkers who have a knack for solving problems and find new ways to captivate millions of customers by putting them at the heart of everything we do. from sky glass sky q peacock and now to news and sports apps we make entertainment even better and we can't wait to get started on what's next. team overviewcontent technology and innovationour content technology and innovation team delivers high quality content to homes customer devices businesses and commercial partners across our european markets. with over 2500 colleagues from around the world we combine our strategic insights engineering know how and operational excellence to use the most innovative technologies to create and distribute our award winning content. the rewards:there's a reason people can't stop talking about #lifeatsky. our great range of rewards really are something special here are just a few:* sky q for the tv you love all in one place * a generous pension package * private healthcare * discounted mobile and broadband * access a wide range of exclusive sky vip rewards and experiences where you'll work:osterley:our osterley campus is a 10 minute walk from syon lane train station. or you can hop on one of our free shuttle buses that run to and from osterley gunnersbury ealing broadway and south ealing tube stations. there's also plenty of bike shelters and showers.on campus you'll find 13 subsidised restaurants cafes and a waitrose. you can keep in shape at our subsidised gym catch the latest shows and movies at our cinema get your car washed and even get pampered at our beauty salon. inclusion:we take pride in our approach to diversity and inclusion: we've been recognised by the times and stonewall for this and we've committed £30million to support the fight against racial injustice. we've also set ambitious targets for increasing ethnic diversity and representation throughout our organisation. at sky we don't just look at your cv. we're more focused on who you are and your potential. we also know that everyone has a life outside work so we're happy to discuss flexible working.and we'll do everything we can to support you during your application. if you need us to make any adjustments to our recruitment process speak to our recruitment team who will be happy to support you. why wait? apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. we can't wait to hear from you. to find out more about working with us search #lifeatsky on social media. a job you love to talk about.just so you know: if your application is successful we'll ask you to complete a criminal record check. and depending on the role you have applied for and the nature of any convictions you may have we might have to withdraw the offer.

software engineer dwp. digital with purpose.dwp need experienced software engineers to help us compile build and deploy software services that work for us and for our millions of users.we're looking for engineers and developers who think code and craft using java or javascript/node.js. initially you'll be working on transforming the products and services people access through dwp jobcentres with regular releases creating new functionality and critical maintenance.our agile teams are using the latest tech and tooling to deliver a generational change to the way dwp works and to the way people interact with government.the scale of our engineering challenge is incredible:we have 1bn lines of code in over 12 000 code repos and 90+ programming languages. that's more lines of codes than there are calories in 7.2m strawberry delights.we run around 294 days' worth of testing every day through automation. you could get a rocket to mars in that time.our apis receive 173 million requests and we spin up 280 000 aws servers every month.over 22 million people 1/3 of the uk's adult population access our services daily. over 100 000 colleagues and agents use the kit tools and systems we roll out. we're one of the biggest payers in europe with over £195bn payments made annually.we're working at home a lot at the moment because of covid 19 and our ongoing offer includes hybrid home/hub based working. our pension offer is great too with 27.1% pension contributions so you can look after your own future while creating solutions that empower others to do the same.what skills knowledge and experience do you need to show us in your application?open source technologies like java javascript node.js.developing on cloud based environments like aws and azure.a good understanding of test driven development tdd sql and nosql database applications such as postgres mysql and mongodb.containerisation tools such as docker and kubernetes.the skills to build up a useful robust automated test suite to support a continuous deployment environment.knowledge and experience of apis restful services and microservice architectures.details. wages. perks.you'll join us in one of our digital hubs in the your choice of birmingham blackpool leeds manchester sheffield or newcastle.we also all have the tech and tools we need to enable our people to work flexibly and many of us are working remotely at the moment due to covid 19.we offer competitive pay up to £55 666 and a brilliant civil service pension with employer contributions of 27.1%. for a starting salary for example of £40 000 that would be nearly £11 000 in your pension pot from us each year.you'll also get a generous leave package starting at 26 days 25 days annual leave plus a day for the queen's birthday plus the ability to take extra days using flexi leave.we also have a broad benefits package built around your work life balance which includes:flexible working flexi hours and flexi dayshybrid working: some time in a hub with the team some time at homefamily friendly policiestime off volunteering and charitable givingbring your authentic self to work with 'i can be me in dwp'discounts and savings on shopping fun days out and moreinterest free loans to buy a bike or a season ticket so it's even easier for you to get to work and start making a differencesports and social activitiesworking in an award winning environment and cultureprofessional development coaching mentoring and career progression opportunities.click apply for further information and to start an application on civil service jobs.

5+ years hands on development experience using the latest microsoft technologies· solid understanding of .net framework· expertise in c# .net wpf mvvm· strong understanding of design patterns and solid principles· sql server data storage and retrieval including writing complex queries · source control svn or git · experience with prism would be an advantage· experience of linux and c/c++ embedded systems would be an advantage· experience of ms visual basic would be an advantagepersonal attributes· ability to work in a team· should be able to confidently contribute in technical discussions· willingness to learn and improvedesirable· prior experience developing in an n tiered environment· understanding of scrum and agile.· understanding of plc programmingjoin the team!interested? we look forward to receiving your application.external agencies are kindly requested not to contact the company regarding this post

software engineer bbc news offers a wide range of stretching creative and impactful careers for talented people. we are the team that’s building the future of the bbc whilst delivering tv radio and online services to millions of people worldwide every day. in the elections team we are focused on giving the public clear information about the democratic process. we’re a full stack team focused on getting accurate information about elections results to our audience quickly at scale and most importantly clearly. often our audiences either don’t understand the electoral process the terminology used or struggle with numbers and it’s part of the bbc’s remit to help make this clear. we offer challenging work but with the time to think and do things right. we value diversity & inclusion everywhere at the bbc and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply for the role. if you are interested to know more about us please explore the following links: blogs: https://medium.com/bbc design engineering opensource: https://www.bbc.co.uk/opensource/ github: https://github.com/bbc general d+e info: https://www.bbc.com/backstage/design engineering technical: our stack is built from javascript and golang. if you don’t know them we can train you so demonstrable skill in: javascript typescript python java golang are all acceptable if you’re willing to learn. we operate as a devops team and own our own infrastructure on aws; experience of working in this way is a plus. knowledge of sql databases or any other databases a plus. championing new technologies and approaches to ensure our products remain world class. collaborating effectively to deliver the best value audience experience. ensuring your code meets high quality standards through testing and peer reviews. people: working with others to get things done in a proactive and positive way. working with journalists and designers on new application concepts and building prototypes. contributing to an environment of engineering excellence and continuous improvement. mentoring and training new team members. contributes to creating safe and inclusive working environments. we’re keen to speak with people who have experience designing developing and supporting large complex systems at scale with one or more modern programming languages and/or frameworks. this is a great opportunity to learn new skills and languages. we’d also be keen to see experience of cloud infrastructure and automated testing techniques. experience of project working and professional software development processes including agile behaviour driven development and test driven development would be preferable as well as supporting software in a production environment. finally we value experience communicating effectively with both technical and non technical colleagues at all levels in an organisation. we create and support reliable and scalable cloud based systems on amazon web services use git and github for version control continuous integration and continuous deployment. proud member of the disability confident employer scheme about disability confident a disability confident employer will generally offer an interview to any applicant that declares they have a disability and meets the minimum criteria for the job as defined by the employer. it is important to note that in certain recruitment situations such as high volume seasonal and high peak times the employer may wish to limit the overall numbers of interviews offered to both disabled people and non disabled people. for more details please go to disability confident.

junior software engineer junior software engineersalary: £30k £36k depending on experience + excellent benefitslocation: bury manchesterfull time/permanentremarkable jobs are delighted to be working with a global client who is a market leader within their industry and assist them with the recruitment of a 'junior software engineer' to join their existing development team.this 'junior software developer' role will join an existing small team of developers and will be involved heavily with the design and delivery of software platforms primarily focussing on web development for web applications. key technologies that are used by the current ream include git java spring mysql angular java react and more.this 'junior software engineer' would be ideal for a candidate with a small amount of experience with full stack development or who is keen to develop their full stack knowledge. 'software engineer' main responsibilities:• build software components and modules following agreed patterns methodologies and designs.• investigate issues with deployed software and then create bug fixes.• understand the impact of different design options and manage risks.• participate code reviews on your own work and improve on software based on feedback.• contribute to wider technical discussions within the wider team. qualifications key skills and experience required for this 'software engineer' role:• degree educated or equivalent in a software engineering subject.• experienced with delivering software solutions.• possess knowledge of java spring and java script html css mysql or angular.• an understanding of software development techniques and deployment.• be keen to learn new systems and be a quick learner.• have excellent communication skills both written and verbal.• a strong team player with excellent organisational skills. for immediate consideration please apply today! interviews for this role will be conducted remotely.

senior software engineer senior software engineersalary: £70k £80klocation: remote based with occasional office visits to manchesterfull time/permanentremarkable jobs are delights to be working with a global software company who are quickly becoming a market leader within their industry. we are assisting our client with the recruitment of a 'senior software engineer' to join their existing development team.this 'senior software engineer' role will be joining a team that is responsible for building saas software for global customers. this role will be heavily involved with a long term project to enhance iterate and modernise a software platform.to be successful in this position you will need to be a self starter with advanced knowledge of technology platforms such as .net sql server and modern javascript development. 'senior software engineer' main responsibilities:• design and implement new software to meet specific requirements.• write well designed testable and secure code.• produce specification and determine operational feasibility.• develop the software verification process and quality assurance procedures.• integrate software components into a functioning software system.• provide feedback and suggest improvements to existing software and all aspects of the software development life cycle.• troubleshoot debug and apply upgrades to existing software to maintain performance and quality.• mentor junior team members on development best practises. experience skills and qualifications for this 'senior software engineer' role:• 4+ years of experience as a full stack javascript and .net developer.• highly proficient in javascript and enterprise web development.• excellent experience with .net core c# asp.net mvc and azure functions.• strong experience with git and microservices.• experienced with designing web apis on a large scale.• possess strong ms sql skills and experience with t sql.• knowledge of microsoft azure or aws.• the ability to work in a fast paced environment. for immediate consideration please apply today! interviews for this position will be conducted remotely.

junior or graduate software engineer graduate or junior software engineerestablished in 1985 crowder consulting consists of a growing team of over 120 consulting engineers software developers and data analysts. as an sme we are able to offer our leading water network management system netbase to water operators in the uk and internationally. our flagship netbase system is a data rich hub that acts as a digital twin of our client water operators’ networks with a suite of best practice applications providing source to tap insights for network monitoring operation optimisation management and regulatory reporting. our netbase digital services platform extends the value and insights of the netbase data hub providing advanced web based technologies and solutions supporting innovative analytics operational field services and leakage activities. our people are at the heart of what we do and we’re proud to say we’ve been investors in people accredited since 2004 testament to our dedication to support all colleagues with their career development. we are looking for junior software engineers or computer science graduates to join our development team and help drive the ambitious roadmap for our cloud based solutions and services. the role – graduate or junior software engineeras a software engineer you’ll work with some of the latest technologies and be involved in the end to end software development life cycle. you’ll carry out requirements analysis working closely with our in house domain experts; designing developing and testing components apis and applications; monitoring and supporting operational systems and implementing dev ops best practice and researching new technologies prototyping and bringing innovation to our solutions.the packageas a junior or graduate software engineer you’ll benefit from:• a starting salary of £25 000 or higher dependent upon your experience skills and qualifications • permanent contract working 37.5 hours per week monday to friday with flexible start times between 8am and 10am and finish times between 4:30pm and 6:30pm • employer contributory pension scheme• annual leave entitlement that increases with length of servicewe’re based in birkenhead although there may be a requirement for you to work from home initially due to the covid 19 government restrictions. we’re reviewing a hybrid approach to working post covid as suited to business requirements. our requirements – graduate or junior software engineeryou should be enthusiastic about the latest software trends and technologies and have a willingness to learn progress and grow within the team. you’ll also have: • degree level education in computer science or relevant subject and / or a foundation of experience within a similar software engineering role• experience of a high level programming language java python nodejs typescript c# • appreciation of software development practices and design ooad ddd tdd patterns although not essential exposure to any of the following would be advantageous:• developing desktop web or mobile applications• cloud technologies aws azure gcp serverless containers • web technologies rest api html5 javascript angular react • database technologies oracle mysql mongo dynamodb etc • devops practices and tools configuration as code ci/cd docker • experience of working in an agile environmentall applications for this junior or graduate software engineer vacancy are to be submitted online and strictly no agency calls or agency cv submissions.

associate software engineer are you starting your career as a software engineer?are you looking for an engaging environment with the opportunity to deliver innovative technology?we’re looking for outstanding software engineers who want to contribute to demanding and exciting digital services for the uk government. be part of changing the face of public services with the potential to dramatically transform the future of millions of people. our engineers build and run applications as part of a multi functional agile delivery teams. what really excites the successful candidate is problem solving and the opportunity to deliver technology that carries real value for users. the candidate will be expected to draw value from collaboration with others actively seek input from colleagues and value a multidisciplinary team over hierarchy.the successful candidate will join identity and trust id&t within shared channels experience. id&t is tasked with accurately establishing customers’ identity when interacting with dwp services regardless of the form of communication protecting both dwp and the customer while removing the need to repeatedly undergo identification processes throughout the journey.check out these blogs aboutas an associate software engineer you will help develop and maintain software products that make up citizen and organisation facing services and contribute towards their design.working with a team you will be responsible for the operational stability of the products you build and be in a position to affect change in the on going robustness and resilience of those products.you will work within and contribute to the overall software development lifecycle process as part of a multi functional agile delivery team focused on one or more products.you will:• deliver software products which make up services for our citizens to consume.• ensure system robustness resilience and stability.• help design and develop reusable libraries and services and promote reuse across the department.• collaborate to produce comprehensive suites of automated unit and integration tests to ensure code quality.• identify and resolve issues preventing delivery or continuation of software engineering activities.

software engineer our client is seeking an enthusiastic person able to adapt to changing priorities within a multi disciplined software engineering team. you will be willing to travel occasionally and have strong technical skills with experience of software design patterns development best practices and configuration management. working in sedgefield for a leading supplier of radiation detection components and devices for the medical imaging civil nuclear industry cbrne security and safety screening markets; you will be educated to degree level or have equivalent in relevant software computing or engineering subject. this is a full time weekday role primarily office based with the possibility of two days a week homeworking. responsibilitieschecking product functionality against requirementsmaintaining and developing and key software solutionscommunicating with peers to problem solve and reach decisionswriting and maintaining clean simple easy to debug and understand code essential technical skillsstrong c# and/or c++agile specifically scrum development experiencegit or svn version controlazure devops or equivalentmvvm coding style / solid principles /design patternsmicrosoft windows development / .net core standard / wpfexcellent microsoft visual studio skills desirable technical skillscross platform cmakelinux developmentexperience of working with radiation electronics and/or scientific productsunderstanding of development processes including milestone planningusb bluetooth ethernet communication protocolsoffice 365 experience in the first instance please send cv.

software engineer here at axa we’re on an exciting journey with the next level of significant investment planned in all ukandi businesses to transform and deliver new digital services to our customers and streamline and automate our business processes. to help us develop and maintain our software platforms in our insurance team we’re looking for a talented individual with superb analytical skills and a passion for making a difference to join this growing team.as a software engineer within the axa insurance engineering community you will be working within one of our multi disciplinary engineering teams to maintain and develop axa's software platforms using industry best practices and standards. you will work at every stage of the engineering lifecycle from design to production support using a range of tools and languages as well as good analytical skills to be a key influencer in driving continuous improvement and delivery as part of a fast paced agile environment. if you are a developer who loves to collaborate and problem solve whether just starting out in your career or ready for the next step we want to hear from you.at axa we’re adopting a hybrid way of working empowering our people to balance their time between home and office in a way that works best for them their team and our customers. what you’ll be doing: develop solutions to the required quality design coding performance and security standards. ensure quality and continuous improvement through design reviews code reviews and retrospectives. take collective ownership for the platform responding to its needs for stability and availability and by being consistent with agreed platform principles. work to continuously improve the platform through removal of technical debt and championing of new technologies. provide technical analysis of user requirements to facilitate accurate story estimation. work closely with colleagues to share knowledge and ensure the continuous growth of our community oriented environment. ensure solutions have test coverage with a shift left mindset. evaluate the potential for automation to remove manual effort and increase efficiency.

software engineer gmk software solutions limited based in aylesbury buckinghamshire offers efficient high quality it solutions to its customers.the organization has identified the need for experienced professionals to undertake the role of software engineer to take responsibility for examining existing software and determining requirements for new or modified systems investigating planning designing coding and developing software solutions for clients and installing implementing and maintaining the reliability and security of software systems.the successful applicants be a graduate with a degree level qualification or nqf level 6 or above in a computer related field or significant experience in a similar position of responsibility.responsibilities:applicants to demonstrate technical expertise in open identity manager oidm 3.0 or greater platform with a focus on implementing certifications access requests and provisioning/workflows in an enterprise wide deployment.develop re engineering testing and debugging software codes oidm 3.0 connectors and workflows ui customization online help soa approval.custom code development of connectors and adapters in oim 3.0 or greater is an absolute requirementsupport all production changes and implementations; coordinate with various smes and project managers on taking development led efforts to productionperform system integration and software designs development and design document and specification to customer requirementsable to generate artifacts such as design documents deployment guides and operational guides as part of ownership of a development work effort or effortsskills and qualification required:good skills of windows scripting such as windows powershell scripts.analytical skills to derive and translate business level information into technical specifications and must be able to evaluate technology from a business and technical perspective.logical approach to problem solving and analytical skillsjava j2ee open identity manager are required.excellent written communication skills are required.

software engineer want to do the best work of your life? with 24 million customers in 6 countries make your mark at europe's leading media and entertainment brand. a workplace where you can proudly be yourself; our people make sky a truly exciting and inclusive place to work. sky advertising technology provides innovative solutions to sky's advertising opportunities including the industry leading adsmart that allows our clients to precisely target their adverts to relevant households. as a software engineer you'll be helping to create those systems and be part of the migration of adtech systems into the cloud. what you'll do:* help to build applications that are core to sky's market leading adsmart platform * champion the departments adoption of cloud technologies * work with the automation tester to ensure we deliver well tested applications with a robust ci/cd pipeline. * engage with the wider adtech and sky developer communities. what you'll bring:* solid experience of delivering secure performant applications in a variety of languages java go c# python javascript/typescript and sql in a cloud based environment gcp/aws * good experience of infrastructure as code terraform kubernetes clusters and cloud native tools like big query cloud composer cloud build or their aws equivalents . * complete commitment to excellent software engineering standards. * an appetite to expand your horizons to look at new technology and assess how best to leverage it. department overview: we're the product hub. we're the team behind your favourite sky products and the platforms that power them. we make every moment magical everywhere. our team is made up of self motivated big thinkers who have a knack for solving problems and find new ways to captivate millions of customers by putting them at the heart of everything we do. from sky glass sky q peacock and now to news and sports apps we make entertainment even better and we can't wait to get started on what's next. team overviewcontent technology and innovationour content technology and innovation team delivers high quality content to homes customer devices businesses and commercial partners across our european markets. with over 2500 colleagues from around the world we combine our strategic insights engineering know how and operational excellence to use the most innovative technologies to create and distribute our award winning content. the rewards:there's a reason people can't stop talking about #lifeatsky. our great range of rewards really are something special here are just a few:* sky q for the tv you love all in one place * a generous pension package * private healthcare * discounted mobile and broadband * access a wide range of exclusive sky vip rewards and experiences where you'll work:osterley:our osterley campus is a 10 minute walk from syon lane train station. or you can hop on one of our free shuttle buses that run to and from osterley gunnersbury ealing broadway and south ealing tube stations. there's also plenty of bike shelters and showers.on campus you'll find 13 subsidised restaurants cafes and a waitrose. you can keep in shape at our subsidised gym catch the latest shows and movies at our cinema get your car washed and even get pampered at our beauty salon. inclusion:we take pride in our approach to diversity and inclusion: we've been recognised by the times and stonewall for this and we've committed £30million to support the fight against racial injustice. we've also set ambitious targets for increasing ethnic diversity and representation throughout our organisation. at sky we don't just look at your cv. we're more focused on who you are and your potential. we also know that everyone has a life outside work so we're happy to discuss flexible working.and we'll do everything we can to support you during your application. if you need us to make any adjustments to our recruitment process speak to our recruitment team who will be happy to support you. why wait? apply now to build an amazing career and be part of a brilliant team. we can't wait to hear from you. to find out more about working with us search #lifeatsky on social media. a job you love to talk about.just so you know: if your application is successful we'll ask you to complete a criminal record check. and depending on the role you have applied for and the nature of any convictions you may have we might have to withdraw the offer.

software engineer dwp. digital with purpose.dwp need experienced software engineers to help us compile build and deploy software services that work for us and for our millions of users.we're looking for engineers and developers who think code and craft using java or javascript/node.js. initially you'll be working on transforming the products and services people access through dwp jobcentres with regular releases creating new functionality and critical maintenance.our agile teams are using the latest tech and tooling to deliver a generational change to the way dwp works and to the way people interact with government.the scale of our engineering challenge is incredible:we have 1bn lines of code in over 12 000 code repos and 90+ programming languages. that's more lines of codes than there are calories in 7.2m strawberry delights.we run around 294 days' worth of testing every day through automation. you could get a rocket to mars in that time.our apis receive 173 million requests and we spin up 280 000 aws servers every month.over 22 million people 1/3 of the uk's adult population access our services daily. over 100 000 colleagues and agents use the kit tools and systems we roll out. we're one of the biggest payers in europe with over £195bn payments made annually.we're working at home a lot at the moment because of covid 19 and our ongoing offer includes hybrid home/hub based working. our pension offer is great too with 27.1% pension contributions so you can look after your own future while creating solutions that empower others to do the same.what skills knowledge and experience do you need to show us in your application?open source technologies like java javascript node.js.developing on cloud based environments like aws and azure.a good understanding of test driven development tdd sql and nosql database applications such as postgres mysql and mongodb.containerisation tools such as docker and kubernetes.the skills to build up a useful robust automated test suite to support a continuous deployment environment.knowledge and experience of apis restful services and microservice architectures.details. wages. perks.you'll join us in one of our digital hubs in the your choice of birmingham blackpool leeds manchester sheffield or newcastle.we also all have the tech and tools we need to enable our people to work flexibly and many of us are working remotely at the moment due to covid 19.we offer competitive pay up to £55 666 and a brilliant civil service pension with employer contributions of 27.1%. for a starting salary for example of £40 000 that would be nearly £11 000 in your pension pot from us each year.you'll also get a generous leave package starting at 26 days 25 days annual leave plus a day for the queen's birthday plus the ability to take extra days using flexi leave.we also have a broad benefits package built around your work life balance which includes:flexible working flexi hours and flexi dayshybrid working: some time in a hub with the team some time at homefamily friendly policiestime off volunteering and charitable givingbring your authentic self to work with 'i can be me in dwp'discounts and savings on shopping fun days out and moreinterest free loans to buy a bike or a season ticket so it's even easier for you to get to work and start making a differencesports and social activitiesworking in an award winning environment and cultureprofessional development coaching mentoring and career progression opportunities.click apply for further information and to start an application on civil service jobs.

software engineer for more than 70 years cerulean has been synonymous with the supply of precision test and measurement equipment solutions for the tobacco industry. with continued release of new devices cerulean is committed to delivering the solutions that our customers require investing a significant proportion of its revenue on in house research and product development. this commitment demonstrates the cerulean philosophy of innovation and continuous improvement.reporting to the software manager the successful candidate will be a key member of the software development team responsible for developing software using various technologies of the microsoft stack. the software developer would be responsible for writing code to cerulean standards that is used in a varied key products of the company. coordinating with the hardware engineers to ensure the software produces the desired results. working in various projects involving various technologies with opportunity to improve and learn.key responsibilities· solid understanding of the development lifecycle focusing on the microsoft stack.· create code that meets design specifications follows standards and is easy to maintain. when required make suggestions for new designs.· work with various teams in the organization and deal directly with design engineers to ensure appropriate project requirements are met.· good interpersonal and organizational skills.· ability to work in a cooperative team environment.· great team participation skills.required skills· bachelor’s degree in computer science or related field· 5+ years hands on development experience using the latest microsoft technologies· solid understanding of .net framework· expertise in c# .net wpf mvvm· strong understanding of design patterns and solid principles· sql server data storage and retrieval including writing complex queries · source control svn or git · experience with prism would be an advantage· experience of linux and c/c++ embedded systems would be an advantage· experience of ms visual basic would be an advantagepersonal attributes· ability to work in a team· should be able to confidently contribute in technical discussions· willingness to learn and improvedesirable· prior experience developing in an n tiered environment· understanding of scrum and agile.· understanding of plc programmingjoin the team!interested? we look forward to receiving your application.external agencies are kindly requested not to contact the company regarding this post

software engineer bbc news offers a wide range of stretching creative and impactful careers for talented people. we are the team that’s building the future of the bbc whilst delivering tv radio and online services to millions of people worldwide every day. in the elections team we are focused on giving the public clear information about the democratic process. we’re a full stack team focused on getting accurate information about elections results to our audience quickly at scale and most importantly clearly. often our audiences either don’t understand the electoral process the terminology used or struggle with numbers and it’s part of the bbc’s remit to help make this clear. we offer challenging work but with the time to think and do things right. we value diversity & inclusion everywhere at the bbc and encourage people of all backgrounds to apply for the role. if you are interested to know more about us please explore the following links: blogs: https://medium.com/bbc design engineering opensource: https://www.bbc.co.uk/opensource/ github: https://github.com/bbc general d+e info: https://www.bbc.com/backstage/design engineering technical: our stack is built from engineering excellence and continuous improvement. mentoring and training new team members. contributes to creating safe and inclusive working environments. we’re keen to speak with people who have experience designing developing and supporting large complex systems at scale with one or more modern programming languages and/or frameworks. this is a great opportunity to learn new skills and languages. we’d also be keen to see experience of cloud infrastructure and automated testing techniques. experience of project working and professional software development processes including agile behaviour driven development and test driven development would be preferable as well as supporting software in a production environment. finally we value experience communicating effectively with both technical and non technical colleagues at all levels in an organisation. we create and support reliable and scalable cloud based systems on amazon web services use git and github for version control continuous integration and continuous deployment. proud member of the disability confident employer scheme about disability confident a disability confident employer will generally offer an interview
